intro: Crataegus collina var. collicola, commonly known as the hill hawthorn, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It is characterized by its thorny branches, ovate leaves with serrated edges, and clusters of white to pink flowers that bloom in spring. The plant produces small, red berries in the fall, which are an important food source for birds and small mammals. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or woodland habitats.
